keyword.ja: ファンデルワールス錯体

paper_title.en: Infrared diode laser spectroscopy of N-2-(CO2)-C-12-O-18
paper_title.ja: N2-12C18O2の赤外ダイオードレーザー分光

description.en: The high-resolution infrared spectrum of N-2-(CO2)-C-12-O-18 has been observed in the v(3) band (2314 cm(-1)) region of (CO2)-C-12-O-18 with diode laser absorption spectroscopy of pulsed molecular beam. The geometry of N-2-(CO2)-C-12-O-18 is similar to N-2-(CO2)-C-12-O-16, a T-shaped structure with the nitrogen molecular axis pointing towards the carbon atom. The geometrical parameters of the T-shaped ground-state structure are determined as R-NcmC = 3.7285(5) angstrom and (90-Theta(NcmCO)) = 6.85(3)degrees. The vibrational band origin of N-2-(CO2)-C-12-O-18 corresponding to the v(3) mode of (CO2)-C-12-O-18 shows a shift of 0.52499(10)cm(-1) with respect to that of (CO2)-C-12-O-18. (C) 2011 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Infrared spectroscopy of Ne-<sup>12</sup>C<sup>18</sup>O<sub>2</sub> and Xe-<sup>12</sup>C<sup>18</sup>O<sub>2</sub>: Change in the CO<sub>2</sub> intramolecular potential by formation of rare gas-CO<sub>2</sub> complexes
Infrared spectroscopy of Kr-(CO2)-C-12-O-18: Change in the CO2 intramolecular potential by complex formation and isotope effect on the vibrationally averaged intermolecular geometry

description.en: The high-resolution infrared spectrum of Kr-(CO2)-C-12-O-18 has been observed in the nu(3) band (2314 cm(-1)) region of (CO2)-C-12-O-18 with diode laser absorption spectroscopy of pulsed molecular beam. The vibrational band origin of Kr-(CO2)-C-12-O-18 corresponding to the nu(3) mode of (CO2)-C-12-O-18 shows a shift of Delta nu(0) = -0.86510(30) cm(-1) with respect to that of (CO2)-C-12-O-18. The geometrical parameters of the T-shaped ground-state average structure are determined to be R-KrC = 3.6204(11) angstrom and Theta(KrCO) = 83.51(10)degrees. The change in the CO2 intramolecular potential upon complex formation is derived from the observed red shift Delta nu o(0), and the isotope effects on R-KrC and Theta(KrCO) are reproduced by ab initio calculation. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Infrared spectroscopy of (<sup>12</sup>C<sup>18</sup>O<sub>2</sub>)<sub>2</sub> and isotope effect on the vibrationally averaged structure of (CO<sub>2</sub>)<sub>2</sub>
Infrared absorption spectroscopy of Ar-<sup>12</sup>C<sup>18</sup>O<sub>2</sub> : Change in the intramolecular potential upon complex formation
Analysis of vibration-rotational spectra of KH

description.en: A modified Dunham potential model developed recently was applied to the analysis of vibration-rotational spectra of KH. The spectral data set consisted of 107 lines from the literature and an additional 12 lines measured in the present study. In total 119 spectral lines for four isotopomers were simultaneously fitted to a single set of only 11 molecular parameters, U-omega, U-B, a(1), a(2), a(3), a(4), a(5), Delta(omega)(H), Delta(B)(. H) and Delta(al)(H), well within experimental errors. Values of omega(e)((KH)-K-39) and r(e) within the Born-Oppenheimer approximation are 986.6484(41) cm(-1) and 224.0164(10) pm, respectively, assuming that Delta(omega)(K) and Delta(B)(K) are equal to zero. (C) 1997 Elsevier Science B.V.

paper_title.en: Infrared diode laser spectroscopy of a high-temperature molecule: GeSe

description.en: The vibrational-rotational spectrum of GeSe has been observed with a diode laser spectrometer equipped with a single pass cell of heat-pipe oven type. About 770 spectral lines for the Delta nu = 1 band sequences of six isotopomers of GeSe have been assigned between 380 to 420 cm(-1). These data have been analyzed in combination with 138 microwave data from the literature by two different methods of least-squares fit to different potential functions. The qualities of the fits are nearly equal. The value of omega(c) is determined to be 402.66129(70) cm(-1) for (GeSe)-Ge-74-Se-80.

paper_title.en: INFRARED DIODE-LASER SPECTROSCOPY OF A HIGH-TEMPERATURE MOLECULE GES USING SPECTRUM PROCESSING BY FOURIER TRANSFORMATION

description.en: The vibrational-rotational spectrum of GeS has been observed using a diode laser spectrometer equipped with a heat-pipe high-temperature cell of a White cell type. Fringes due to optical reflections inside the high-temperature White cell were inherent in the observation of the spectra. However, they were eliminated, as were high-frequency noises, by Fourier manipulation of the observed diode laser spectrum. About 620 spectral lines for the Delta upsilon = 1 band sequences of the eight isotopomers, (GeS)-Ge-74-S-32, (GeS)-Ge-72-S-32, (GeS)-Ge-70-S-32, (GeS)-Ge-73-S-32, (GeS)-Ge-76-S-32, (GeS)-Ge-74-S-34, (GeS)-Ge-72-S-34, and (GeS)-Ge-70-S-34 have been assigned between 522 and 593 cm(-1). These infrared data combined with 91 microwave data from the literature have been analyzed with a least-squares fit to a Dunham potential function with only 11 parameters which included three Watson type Delta correction terms. The Dunham Y-ij coefficients have been derived for each of the eight isotopomers. The equilibrium vibrational frequency omega(e), of (GeS)-Ge-74-S-32 is 574.269 313(271) cm(-1).

The high-resolution infrared spectrum of Br Cl has been observed with a Fourier transform spectrometer. About 850 spectral lines for the Delta v = 1 sequences of the four isotopic species, (BrCl)-Br-79-Cl-35, (BrCl)-Br-81-Cl-35, (BrCl)-Br-79-Cl-37, and (BrCl)-Br-81-Cl-37 have been measured between 417 and 461 cm(-1). They have been fitted with a standard deviation of 0.000 146 cm(-1) to a Dunham potential function using eight coefficients that included two Watson-type Delta correction terms. Dunham Y-ij coefficients have been derived for each of the four isotopic species. The equilibrium internuclear distance r(e) of BrCl is 2.136 053 28 (67) Angstrom.

paper_title.en: Infrared diode laser spectroscopy of the Δv=2 band of NaBr using spectrum processing by Fourier transformation
INFRARED DIODE-LASER SPECTROSCOPY OF HIGH-TEMPERATURE MOLECULES USING SPECTRUM PROCESSING BY FOURIER TRANSFORMATION

description.en: A heat-pipe high-temperature cell of the White cell type was constructed for sensitive detection of the spectra of high-temperature molecules. It has been incorporated into the optical system of a tunable diode laser spectrometer. With a 40 m optical path length abundant spectral lines of the DELTAupsilon=2 vibration-rotation bands of NaBr have been observed in the wavenumber range between 560 and 600 cm-1. The technique of spectrum processing by use of Fourier transformation was applied to the source-modulated diode laser spectrum to eliminate fringes and to improve the signal-to-noise ratio.

An infrared emission spectrum of the DELTAv = 1 bands of AlBr has been observed with a Fourier transform spectrometer with 0.1 cm-1 resolution. The v = 1-0 to 3-2 and v = 5-4 vibration-rotation bands of (AlBr)-Br-79 and the v = 1-0 to 5-4 bands of (AlBr)-Br-81 were assigned in the wavenumber range between 310 and 400 cm-1. The infrared data combined with millimeter-wave data from the literature were analyzed with a least-squares fit to a Dunham potential function with only seven parameters. Thirteen Dunham Y(ij) coefficients have been derived for each of the isotopic species.

The infrared emission spectrum of DELTAupsilon = 1 bands of NaBr monomer has been observed with a Fourier transform spectrometer. The upsilon = 1-0 to 5-4 vibration-rotation bands for both (NaBr)-Br-79 and (NaBr)-Br-81 were assigned in the wavenumber range between 225 and 315 cm-1. These infrared data combined with millimeter-wave data from the literature were analyzed with a least-squares fit to a Dunham potential function with only seven parameters. Omega(e)((NaBr)-Br-79) has been determined to be 298.7377(43) cm-1 with one standard error in parentheses. Thirteen Dunham Y(ij) coefficients have been derived for each of the two isotopic species from the Dunham potential function.

paper_title.en: Infrared diode laser spectroscopy of BrF and BrCl

description.en: Diode laser spectra of BrF and BrCl below 700 cm-1 were observed and analyzed. Transitions in the 1-0 and 2-1 bands of 79BrF and 81BrF and those in the 1-0, 2-1, and 3-2 bands of 79Br35Cl, 81Br35Cl, 79Br37Cl, and 81Br37Cl were fitted to seven and eight Dunham coefficients, respectively. Many BrCl lines, which can be used for wavenumber calibration of diode laser spectra, were obtained between 400 and 450 cm-1 with an accuracy of about 0.001 cm-1. © 1988.
